intro: Goldfussia glandibracteata, commonly known as the gland-bracted goldfussia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant features glandular bracts, which are modified leaves that surround the inflorescence and contribute to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
